headline: Mehmet Oz absent from appearance before county Republican committee in northeastern Pennsylvania
author: Robert L. Baker
sentences:
Haire told them, “I will extract a reason before next month’s meeting ... as to why (Oz) did not come to Wyoming County.”
“We are booked with candidates for all three statewide races up to the May 17 election, and I don’t see how we can fit him in looking forward,” he said.

Time was allotted for Dave White, a Delaware County resident running for governor; Clarice Schillinger, a Montgomery County resident running for lieutenant governor, and Oz, who is running for the U.S. Senate seat of Sen. Pat Toomey, who will retire.

TV personality Mehmet Oz, a Republican running for an open Senate seat in Pennsylvania, did not show up as expected for the monthly meeting of the Wyoming County Republican Committee on Tuesday night.
About 45 minutes into the program, county Republican Chair Davis Haire said the former host of “The Dr. Oz Show” had not arrived.
